meanings.definition: To drive, or cause to move, forward or onward
meanings.sent1: The strong wind propelling the sailboat forward.
meanings.sent2: The engine is propelling the car down the road.
meanings.sent3: The rocket propelling the toy car was a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was propelling her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The propelling force of the waterfall was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To provide the force that moves something forward
meanings.sent1: The jet engine propelling the airplane through the sky.
meanings.sent2: The oars propelling the rowboat across the lake.
meanings.sent3: The propelling force of the slingshot launched the water balloon far.
meanings.sent4: His passion was propelling him towards his goals.
meanings.sent5: The propelling energy of the sun drives life on Earth.

meanings.definition: The act of moving something forward
meanings.sent1: The propelling of the train by the locomotive.
meanings.sent2: The propelling of the ball by the player's kick.
meanings.sent3: The propelling of the toy car by the remote control was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The propelling of ideas through collaboration is powerful.
meanings.sent5: The propelling of the rocket into space was a remarkable sight.
